column4: I guess linux has it's advantages but it's the least efficient operating system by far.

I don't see how it is efficient when after 4 hours I still can't do what I want to do. That's a lot of wasted time. Multiply that by every user and think of the lost productivity. With any other OS surely I would be doing what I wanted to do instead of trying to learn the OS after 4 hours.
Wrong. You can't just call every person with a valid complaint a troll. That makes you a sycophant.
The whole purpose of Ubuntu is user friendliness. People should realize that Ubuntu has a long way to go.
four hours is hardly enough time to form a valid opinion
yes we see you
- I already gave him that link. ;)
please ask before PM'ing me thanks
certainly. may I pm you?
please ask in channel for the benefit of all
- This has to do with comments you made. Is that something you want to talk about here?
join ubuntu-ops
you can pm me whenever you like.
they are very helpful there.
that was a misshighligt.
certainly; via unetbootin, usb, for starters
sadly not that simple
it may not allow for booting from usb
you are always taking a risk when you go outside ubuntu package management
I thought it might be a legitimate alternative to kubuntu users who dont' want to install all the GNOME libs on their kubuntu.
